item.title: Trump Administration Turns Up Pressure on China on Several Fronts
item.description: Senior Trump administration officials are discussing banning travel to the U.S. by members of China’s Communist Party and their families, a move that would further heighten tensions between Washington and Beijing.

item.title: Russian Hackers Blamed for Attacks on Vaccine-Related Targets
item.description: A prominent state-backed Russian hacking group was blamed by U.S., U.K. and Canadian government officials for ongoing cyber espionage against organizations involved in the development of coronavirus vaccines and other health-care-related work.

item.title: Rainforest Destruction Accelerates in Brazil
item.description: Deforestation in Brazil’s Amazon is accelerating, according to satellite data from the country’s space agency, despite military deployments aimed at curbing illegal logging.

item.title: Vatican Publishes Manual for Bishops on Handling Sex-Abuse Reports
item.description: The Vatican released an instruction manual for bishops on dealing with reports of clerical sex abuse, in a step toward a more unified response to a long-running scandal for the Catholic Church and the reign of Pope Francis.

item.title: Spate of Raids, Arrests in Russia Spurs Fears of Opposition Crackdown
item.description: Since President Vladimir Putin won a referendum that could prolong his power for years to come, journalists have been detained, the homes of critics raided and a popular governor has been arrested.

item.title: EU's Top Court Restricts Personal-Data Transfers to U.S.
item.description: Thousands of companies will face restrictions on storing information about European Union residents on U.S. servers, after the bloc’s top court ruled that such transfers exposed Europeans to American government surveillance without “actionable rights” to challenge it.
